text:
Hi guys, I'm currently rebuilding a WordPress site which has a HubSpot blog attached to it. Does anyone know the best way to pull the recent posts through to WordPress, please?

I have downloaded and set up the HubSpot connector plugin but it doesn't seem to give the option for a featured image which we need to be included.
I appreciate this is more WP orientated than HS, but any advice greatly appreciated. Thanks!

<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-blog/where-can-i-find-my-HubSpot-blog-rss-feed-url>

<@UC84Q0C7J> you can get the rss feed from this, and then if you want to list them in a widget can use this plugin - <https://wordpress.org/plugins/rss-feed-widget/>

if you want images and styling on the feed, you can use this plugin - <https://wordpress.org/plugins/feedzy-rss-feeds/>
Thanks Umakant for assisting me. My issue is now resolved

I have a big doubt as I only work with website on CMS ...
Is it possible to have a blog in a subdirectory on a non HubSpot website ? like <http://www.website.com/blog|www.website.com/blog> or should I use a subdomain <http://blog.website.com|blog.website.com> ?
You would be better off using a subdomain as this will give you more control over what is included/excluded from the install/blog
is there a way to style the cookie policy information in HubSpot?
been trying to do that without much success
you can style it like anything else.  might need some !important rules, though.

Hello! I have a module that is loaded inside a lot of pages, I can edit it in the Design Manager, yet it doesn't appear in the "Add Module" modal box so that I can add it to new pages. Anyone might be having an idea why this is happening? Thanks
check to see if this is toggled on:
Then also check in the fields themselves to see if the prevent editing is toggled on. If so, toggle it off.
i believe modules that have not been upgraded do not appear either.. i could be wrong
Thanks for jumping in here <@UE24LMGSZ> :raised_hands::luke::raised_hands:
Thanks! You know, it's a bit of embarrassing to realize I could overlook something like that
<@UD53A9UUR> Modules that require upgrade can be added without a problem.
well there you go :slightly_smiling_face:
No need to be embarrassed, just look at my slack history, at least once a week i post something that i overlook. :slightly_smiling_face:
is there a way to change the domain in content staging?
Happy to help :thumbsup:
not to my knowledge

So most portals I've worked with are a mess but my client wants to start off structuring their email templates into a good folder structure with good naming conventions. Has anyone implemented or seen any great folder structures out there for email templates?
I would organize them based on the types of emails they are - subscription, transactional, general correspondence, newsletters etc.
Editting in content settings and noticed certain symbols in js and hubl are now colored black. This def hasnt always been a thing, and its pretty hard to read on a dark blue background
cc. <@U22PNRAJD>
Thanks! Sounds good (and I think what we're going for). For the naming conventions I'm also concerned with a descriptive name getting long ("hero image - one column - two columns - cta")
be cool if you could have a title and description for templates
like hover over template and see description as an overlay
“warning - this email template converts hard”
ha!
I’m right there with you, just yesterday I asked a question that I 5 minutes later went :faceplam:

I remember someone asking about this somewhere else. Apparently, the default  "form" module in HubSpot is actually multiple types of modules stitched together. But I believe HubSpot acknowledged that request and may or may not be working on it. I can't seem to find the original thread
Seriously. What's the term in driving? Road blindness?

So here's a question that I haven't been able to find a really great solution to. Now - I'm mostly front end and don't typically handle things of this scope...but here I am...having to handle.

When ya'll have previously done a complete redesign for an existing large website (50-100+ pages) -- what is the typical process you have gone through? I haven't seen a great way of handling a mass migration from a separate staging environment to the live for a quick replacement and simple handling of redirects. Anybody have any recommendations for handling this process?

Currently we are building on one of the secondary HS domains as to prevent cross-contamination/accidentally replacing existing pages. Right now it looks like we are looking at a page-by-page take down/archive of the live site and migration from the secondary to the primary domain of the staged content, publishing, and then manually checking redirects for all replaced pages. That and having a construction page covering the transition with a site-wide redirect until all pages except the home page are published.

Does this even seem logical??
so - is the OLD site on HubSpot?
yep
HS to HS
and the old and new versions of the site are in the same HS portal correct?
yep

Well you’re in luck. Use Content Staging:
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-user-guide/how-to-redesign-and-relaunch-your-site-with-content-staging>
:slightly_smiling_face: This is where we run into a pickle
as our site was originally set up using some sad practices in terms of using global settings and we have some major conflicting stylesheet, js, everything hates life issues.
ahh,
yeah been there done that
So we have to build in a place where we have full control over the content settings
here’s how I do it

I build a custom module name it “old content settings”
link all of the domain wide stylesheets and javascript files
drop that puppy into every old template, remove the stylesheets and javascript files from the content settings, all except tracking scripts
all new projects I don’t put anything under content settings except tracking codes
just be sure to test thoroughly to make sure you loaded your files in the right order and that you dont miss a template
not half bad
hope there arent 100 templates
indeed it's not! Though the site is a messsssssssss and there are pretty darn close to that many templates
I'm quite determined to make this an easier-to-handle mess for the next person who inherits it... :joy:

Does anyone no how to customize online meeting links? Here's an example: <https://www.skuvault.com/meetings/sarah-thomas/skuvaultdemo?embed=true>.  I'd like to add my own css to better reflect our brand. If you have ideas, please respond as a new thread. Thanks!
thanks in advance!
why cant you add your own css?
It's not a page I created. It's this online meeting link thing that HubSpot auto generates. I haven't found any way to control anything about the page.

yeah -- this is how I'm setting things up now. I think for the process on this puppy, we might have too much craziness to trust this process -- but that is definitely how I'm setting it up for the new design
Having to deal with some crazy jquery shenanigans as well
but thanks for the process for the next time!
and if you add ```.HubSpot .email-form{border: 40px solid #6e7f8f;}``` to your stylesheet, it doesnt work?

What I'm saying is I don't know how to add CSS to the page. I didn't create the page. This link it generated by setting up meetings under Sales > Meetings in the <http://HubSpot.com|HubSpot.com> nav. It creates this page automatically and I seem to have no control over what it looks like.
I have a meeting. I'll check back in a bit.

well to prevent this problem in NEW sites my method is include the required linked stylesheets and js at the template level - my thinking is that this way - HS can possibly do optimizations based on these being template level and not treating it like it’s a custom module

I’ve been advocating for a long time having a “template groups” like functionality that would allow you to apply stylesheets and js files as well as head and footer code to a whole group of templates. allowing you to have the same sort of control that content settings gave but at a local level to the templates, eliminating specifying files multiple times, and removing the annoying content settings problem like you’re currently facing
oh gotchya. as far as i know you can only edit the color in the branding part of your settings..

The biggest thing is, I'd like to get rid of that calendar cartoon above the email field. That's what clashes the most with our branding. But if I could get in there with some custom CSS I would do a lot more.
Thanks mate, very helpful - good to know. Silly little gotcha

fyi - I heard from HubSpot support in September that they are going to do away with them - "We're no longer ungating (assume they mean updating) Collected Forms as we're slowing (??) in the process of sunsetting this tool. ".  I had a client with an issue and they wouldn't enable them for me to test something - told me to embed HubSpot forms instead.
hmm good to know, might have to like make our own implementation of this kinda thing through the api

Hey everyone! I know I've posted about PM software before, but my team wanted me to pose this question to the community:

We're going to be adopting Accello in the next couple months and hoping to be on it full-time beginning in January. For those agencies that use Accello, what did your onboarding process look like and do you have any advice for a smooth transition? We will be moving from DoInbound, for reference.
Curious to know how it works for you. We use a combo of Asana and timely. I believe we are about to swap timely for harvest, though.
Yeah -- this is exactly how I'm setting it up currently... unfortunately I inherited these shenanigans
Well as an FYI those shenanigans at one point were the best practice. Unfortunately no one was thinking about redesigns back then. So this wont be the last time you have to deal with that.
